file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 52-77-00-05 - REAR ELECTRONIC-COMPARTMENT ACCESS HATCH WARNING - ADJUSTMENT/TEST

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL REAR ELECTRONIC-COMPARTMENT ACCESS HATCH WARNING - ADJUSTMENT/TEST EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do a check of the rear electronic-compartment access-hatch warning message. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY REAR ELECTRONIC COMPARTMENT AC- ALL 52-77-00-700-801-A ♦ CESS HATCH WARNING MESSAGE - OP- ERATIONAL CHECK EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 52-77-00 Page 1 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-77-00-700-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. REAR ELECTRONIC COMPARTMENT ACCESS HATCH WARNING MESSAGE - OPERATIONAL CHECK A. General (1) The function of this check is to make sure that the warning message related to the rear electronic-compartment access hatch is shown on the EICAS display. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 23-41-00/1 ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION Rear electronic-compartment access 272 hatch D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Near the aircraft, at the rear fuselage Does the check of the EICAS display in the 1 Helps the other technician cockpit I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Connect the ramp interphone to permit communication between the mechanics (AMM SDS 23-41-00/1). (2) Energize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (3) Make sure that these doors are closed and locked: EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 52-77-00 Page 2 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL - Forward Electronic-Compartment Door - Cockpit Underfloor Access Hatch - Service Door - Baggage Door - Fueling Panel Door - Passenger-Cabin Escape Hatches - Main Door J. Operationally Check Rear Electronic Compartment Door Warning Message (Figure 501) SUBTASK 710-002-A (1) Do the operational check as follows: NOTE: There is a delay of 4 to 5 seconds between the locking of the door and the indications shown on the EICAS display. (a) Fully close the rear electronic-compartment access hatch and, before it locks, monitor the indication on the EICAS display. Result: 1 The EICAS display shows this caution message: - ACCESS DOORS OPN. The MFD shows these indications: - DOOR OPEN (in red). - A red square that shows the rear-electronic-compartment access hatch. (b) Lock the rear-electronic-compartment access hatch and monitor the EICAS display. Result: 1 On the EICAS display, the message below goes out of view: - ACCESS DOORS OPN. On the MFD, the indications below go out of view: - DOOR OPEN. - The red square that shows the rear electronic-compartment access hatch becomes green. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Disconnect the ramp interphone (AMM SDS 23-41-00/1). (2) Deenergize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 52-77-00 Page 3 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
